alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 01 at 2:48AM EST until December 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Lake effect snow showers, briefly moderate to heavy at times to the east of Munising and to the north of Newberry. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Snow accumulations south and west of Munising will be less than 1 inch. West to northwest winds gusting to as high as 50 mph will create considerable blowing snow and brief whiteout conditions in open areas to the east of Munising and to the north of Newberry. Winds will gradually diminish overnight. * WHERE...Alger and Luce Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult around Grand Marais, including M-77 south of Grand Marais, and on M-123 to the north of Newberry. Otherwise, plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause a few power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
